title: ChickWeight Exercise
text:
Have you ever been curious about what affects a chickâ€™s weight? This document explores the ChickWeight dataset using R.
The goal is to compare chick weight across different diets and time points.
Key steps include:

Loading the dataset

Visualizing growth trends

Summarizing results







Based on Real Data



The ChickWeight dataset in R is based on real experimental data.




Code
summary(ChickWeight)


     weight           Time           Chick     Diet   
 Min.   : 35.0   Min.   : 0.00   13     : 12   1:220  
 1st Qu.: 63.0   1st Qu.: 4.00   9      : 12   2:120  
 Median :103.0   Median :10.00   20     : 12   3:120  
 Mean   :121.8   Mean   :10.72   10     : 12   4:118  
 3rd Qu.:163.8   3rd Qu.:16.00   17     : 12          
 Max.   :373.0   Max.   :21.00   19     : 12          
                                 (Other):506          




Code
library(ggplot2)
ggplot(ChickWeight, aes(x = Time, y = weight, color = Diet)) +
  geom_line(aes(group = Chick)) +
  labs(title = "Chick Growth Over Time")












No chicks were harmed in the making of this lesson.







Monitor growth trends over time
Compare diets and weight gain



Diet affects chick body weight. In this study, low-energy feed made fast-growing chicks lighter, while slower-growing chicks compensated by eating more (pauwels2015a?)
(li2016?) found that broiler chicks fed a higher nutrient-density diet gained more weight and did so more efficiently.
